response.answer: To start any quote, first pull up the client in order to access the Account Summary screen. Click the arrow to the right of the Actions field, and then select **New Submission** from the drop-down menu.  What type of quote would you like to start?
Which type of report do you want to order?
response.buttons: Prior Policies|Prior Losses|Credit Bureau|Motor Vehicle|CAT Underwriting

response.answer: What kind of information are you looking to find?
Only permanent ID cards mailed from the company will display the secondary named insured if they are added to the policy. If you need to add someone, check out this job aid link below.
descarray: Waiting for Job Aids

response.answer: Is the policy you are trying to change active on PolicyCenter?

To start a change, navigate to the policy, click the Actions button, select **Change Policy** from the drop-down list. All changes on and after the effective date of the PolicyCenter policy must be made in PolicyCenter.  If this change also impacts the old policy, contact the Personal Lines Service Center to complete a backdated change.
Make the policy change in the policy's current system.

answerarray: I'm sorry, I wasn't able to find an answer to your question. Could you please re-phrase that?

response.answer: Okay, please click below if you'd like to speak to a trainer. Please note, Training Connection hours are Monday-Friday **7:00 AM to 6:30 PM EST** (excluding holidays).

answerarray: Hello there! How can I help you?
Hi! How can I help you?
I am a virtual assistant here to answer your simple questions and make your work life easier.
Although I am not a person, I can answer your simple questions in natural language.

response.answer: I am the Nationwide virtual assistant for agents! I am here to help answer some of your most frequest questions and make your day better.
I have been told a lot of people worked on me, but as far as I am concerned, I belong to Nationwide!
I'm not sure I know my own age!
I am not really sure when my birthday is. I usually think about insurance!

answerarray: I don't really sleep, but then again, I don't really need it!
Unless someone pulls my server plug, I'm always awake!

response.answer: I can help answer several questions commonly asked by agents, such as **where do I start a quote,** **how to order reports,** or **what does this term mean.** Feel free to ask me a question!
I wish I could laugh.
Yes! I am still here.
Right now, you can ask me to define a PolicyCenter term, explain how to find or complete a simple task, or find the right Job Aid or Learning Snack for you.
Thank you for your feedback. I'll let the team know, and we'll work to make this better.
Here is a link to more information about reprinting documents:
descarray: Waiting for Job Aids

response.answer: On the Policy Info screen, click the Mortgagee/Additional Interest link. You can select and edit existing mortgagees or add new ones by clicking Add under the right section. Populate fields and click OK.  Here is a link to more information about editing mortgagees:
descarray: Add Mortagee (Third Party)

response.answer: I am not able to provide information on specific error messages, but in general, there are two types of common errors:  1. Action Required errors prompt for certain fields to be completed to advance to the next screen. 2. System Validation/Informational messages may require action before binding a policy but typically do not prevent quoting.  Here is a link to more information about validation messages:
descarray: Types of Validation Messages in PolicyCenter

response.answer: 1. On the summary screen, click Actions and select 5th vehicle. 2. Review Policy Info, then Drivers, then, Accidents/Violations, and on the Vehicles screen, click Create Vehicle to add VIN and other info. 3. Review Lienholder/Additional screen, and on Coverages, select the right coverage.   Here are some links to more information about adding fifth vehicles:
linkarray: https://agentregistrationdvtad3a.blob.core.windows.net/faqstorager4/R4_How to Quote a New Customer with 5 or more Vehicles.pdf
descarray: How to Quote a New Customer with 5 or more Vehicles
Create 5th Vehicle Policy

response.answer: To change a billing account, for a quoted submission, navigate to the Payment screen. For bound policies, Exclusive Agents can use BAM directly, Independent Agents should use AgentCenter.  Here are some links to more information about changing account billing:
linkarray: https://agentregistrationdvtad3a.blob.core.windows.net/faqstorager4/R4_Create a Billing Account for a New Submission.pdf
descarray: Create a Billing Account for a New Submission
Multi - Source Down Payments

response.answer: To begin eSignature, click View Documents, then check the box agreeing to use of electronic record and signatures. Click Start, navigate through the pages, and then click or draw a signature before clicking Finish.  Here is a link to more information about sending documents:
descarray: Create e - Signature Envelope (Electronic Signature)

response.answer: To begin eSignature, click View Documents, then check the box agreeing to use of electronic record and signatures. Click Start, navigate through the pages, and then click or draw a signature before clicking Finish. Agent will receive an e-mail once all signatures are attained.   Here is a link to more information about the eSignature process:
descarray: e-Signature Process for Signers

response.answer: To find underwriting comments, navigate to My Activities in your Desktop tab, and click the link of the activity you wish to review comments on. Click the View Notes button to view the notes from the underwriter.  Here is a link to more information about finding underwriting comments:
descarray: Follow-up Capabilities for Agents

response.answer: 1. Click the Underwriting link to review the approval reason. 2. Click Request Approval for the blocking bind, and fill out Description, Topic, Subject, and any useful text. 3. You'll see a decision later under My Activities on your Desktop tab.   Here are some links to more information about unlocking a policy:
descarray: Clear Underwriting PreQuote Issue
Request Underwriter Approval

response.answer: To find a list of renewals, click the Team tab in PolicyCenter and then click the Renewals link. The display defaults to renewals in Open, but click the arrow to the right of status and select Renewed.    Here is a link to more information about finding a policy renewal:
descarray: Policy Renewal Process (Team Tab)

response.answer: To edit policy renewals: 1. From Work Orders in Progress of the policy Summary screen, click the Work Order # link. 2. Click Edit, OK, and on the Policy Info screen, click Coverages. 3. Make edits, click Policy Review, review changes, click Quote, review, and click Renew. Click OK.   Here is a link to more information about editing a policy renewal:
descarray: Policy Renewal Process (Team Tab)

response.answer: For Catastrophe Services reports, click Re-Order CAT Services EQ or the Re-Order CAT Service HU button.   Here is a link to more information about ordering reports:
descarray: Report Ordering

response.answer: Click Re-Order Motor Vehicle Records, but this is only available with "No Hit" status.   Here is a link to more information about ordering reports:
descarray: Report Ordering

response.answer: You can simply click re-order credit bureau report.   Here is a link to more information about ordering reports:
descarray: Report Ordering

response.answer: To Re-Order Loss History report, click the Re-Order Auto Loss History Report button or Re-Order Loss History Report button.   Here is a link to more information about ordering reports:
descarray: Report Ordering

response.answer: The Prior Policies tab provides current carrier information returned from the Current carrier report returned with ALH.   Here is a link to more information about ordering reports:
descarray: Report Ordering

response.answer: In PolicyCenter, there are three options for entering underlying policies. Which would you like to learn more about?
response.buttons: Create Policy|Retrieve Account Policies|Retrieve Additional Policies

response.answer: The Create Policy button is used when you need to add an AgentCenter policy, such as a Nationwide affiliated company (Allied, or Harleysville), a Nationwide-Hagerty, a Powersports, or a Private Client underlier to the submission.   Here are some links to more information about umbrella policies:
linkarray: https://agentregistrationdvtad3a.blob.core.windows.net/faqstorager4/R4_Umbrella Full Application - Underlying Policies on AgentCenter.pdf

Umbrella Full Application - Retrieve Account Policies - Underlying Policies on PolicyCenter
Umbrella Full Application - Underlying Policies on PolicyCenter
Add an Underlier_Umbrella

response.answer: The Retrieve Account Policies button is used to retrieve existing Nationwide policies on the PolicyCenter account. The system automatically engages this function if underlying policies exits on the PolicyCenter account.   Here are some links to more information about umbrella policies:
